name: Entertainment Activities
description: From waterfront karaoke bars to mini-golf with cocktails, sensory maze experiences and dedicated art-house cinemas... there is no shortage of fun things to do in Auckland. Browse the range of activities to keep you entertained in the city centre.

location.address: From waterfront karaoke bars to mini-golf with cocktails, sensory maze experiences and dedicated art-house cinemas... there is no shortage of fun things to do in Auckland. Browse the range of activities to keep you entertained in the city centre. Fun things to do in Auckland Holey Moley Golf Club and Karaoke Room Putt your way through wacky movie sets Reminisce as you putt your way through this mini-golf labyrinth inspired by your favourite childhood movies. Auckland Art Gallery Join a free life drawing class at lunch Whether you’re a beginner or an expert, grab a stool, pad and pencil and get creating at these drop-in drawing sessions. All Blacks Experience Become an All Black for the day Learn the story and experience the All Blacks story up close. Plus get a chance to meet one in person! The Civic Go behind the scenes of Auckland's most iconic theatre Step behind the scenes and discover the secrets of Auckland's most iconic theatre, The Civic on a journey that spans almos SkyJump Jump off the country's tallest building Channel a movie stuntman & jump from 192m high, falling approx. 4Cuts of Life Say cheese at a selfie photo booth Grab a prop, pop into the photo booth, and capture some seriously awesome pics! New Zealand Maritime Museum Watch a cannon fire Bet you didn't know a cannon fires every day at the Viaduct! Makerspace Unleash your imagination in this creative hub Let your inner creative run wild in this innovative hub equipped with 3D printers, sewing machines, creative software and Dr Rudi's Rooftop Brewing Co. Bowl a strike at this bar's bowling alley Down a few pins in between drinks at this awesome bowling alley in one of the Viaduct's top rooftop bars. GameOn Arcade Escape reality, explore fantasy worlds Driving simulators are fun and all... but have you tried a VR version? Creative Workshops at Wētā Workshop Unleashed Step into a wacky fantasy world and become a special effects master Unleash your creative side and learn new skills from the Wētā Workshop pros with these hands-on workshops. Previous Next Fun with a group Queen Street Timezone Timezone makes a triumphant return to Queen Street. This vibrant social and entertainment hub marks a highly anticipated... Add to favourites Aotea Arts Quarter GameOn Arcade Come and visit New Zealand's largest amusement games arcade with four rooms of arcade games Add to favourites High Street District Studio Self New Zealand's first self-taking photography studio is nestled on Elliot Street for you and your loved ones to capture lasting... Add to favourites Aotea Arts Quarter Metrolanes Bowling This is bowling in style, and is fun for all ages and abilities. Add to favourites Aotea Arts Quarter The Classic Comedy and Bar NZ’s only fulltime professional comedy club is an institution on the local entertainment scene. Add to favourites Queen Street Cue City Beneath the vibrant streets of Auckland lies Cue City - a hidden haven for pool and billiards enthusiasts! Add to favourites Aotea Arts Quarter Escapade Escapade is a live escape game that tests your mind and teamwork skills. Add to favourites FRIDAYS 12pm-1pm Lunchtime Drop-in Drawing Connect with your choice of art in this BYO drawing encounter, every Friday lunchtime. Add to favourites Queen Street Odysseum Odyssey is a sensory maze experience you will never forget. Add to favourites Aotea Arts Quarter Great Escape Great Escape is a fun and simple, yet challenging real life escape game. Add to favourites Previous Next See what's on over summer for more inspiration Don't miss out on these activities WEDNESDAYS TO SATURDAYS | FROM 9PM Live music at Father Ted's Enjoy live music at this inner-city Irish bar every Wednesday to Saturday from 9pm. Add to favourites FORTNIGHTLY ON MONDAYS, 6.30pm Archived: The Tuning Fork's Monday Music Quiz Join The Tuning Fork for a night filled with fun, laughter, great food, and incredible prizes. Add to favourites Attractions to visit Aotea Arts Quarter Auckland Art Gallery History, heritage and culture are brought to life at Auckland Art Gallery Toi o Tāmaki, home to a series of permanent... Add to favourites Federal Street Sky Tower The Sky Tower offers a truly captivating experience. At 328 metres, it is the tallest man-made structure in New Zealand and... Add to favourites Federal Street Wētā Workshop Unleashed Step into a fantastical film effects workshop and explore the worlds of horror, sci-fi and fantasy in-the-making. Add to favourites Federal Street All Blacks Experience A fully guided, state-of-the-art, interactive experience celebrating the All Blacks and our national teams in black. Add to favourites The Viaduct Auckland Whale & Dolphin Safari Discover the glorious Hauraki Gulf Marine Park. Add to favourites The Viaduct New Zealand Maritime Museum Cast off for a journey to discover New Zealand’s story. The New Zealand Maritime Museum tells the maritime stories that... Add to favourites Aotea Arts Quarter Albert Park Albert Park's long history and distinctive character has earned it a special place in the hearts of Aucklanders. Add to favourites Vintage Views Discover Auckland from the top deck of a classic icon. Add to favourites Previous Next For thrill seekers Other Auckland Bridge Bungy Auckland is home to the worlds first harbour bridge bungy jump and is operated by the bungy originals - AJ Hackett Bungy. Add to favourites Other Auckland Bridge Climb Only AJ Hackett Bungy can offer you this level of access to the Auckland Harbour Bridge; and this is the one and only Bridge... Add to favourites Federal Street SkyWalk Take in the spectacular views of Auckland while walking around the 1.2 metre wide platform a dizzying 192 metres up! Add to favourites The Viaduct Auckland Adventure Jet Auckland’s supercharged 35 minute thrill ride around the harbour shows you the city sights while getting your adrenaline... Add to favourites Previous Next

name: Getting Active
description: From yoga studios to free running clubs and bike rides along the picturesque waterfront, getting active is easy in the city centre.

location.address: From yoga studios to free running clubs and bike rides along the picturesque waterfront, getting active is easy in the city centre. Best yoga studios in the city City Works Depot Redroom Wellness Offering Infrared Yoga, Pilates & Strength classes with optional red light therapy recovery sessions, Redroom is a space to... Add to favourites Federal Street Auckland Yoga Academy The Auckland Yoga Academy offers fitness, relaxation and mindful exercise in the heart of the city. Add to favourites Queen Street HIYOGA This downtown studio provides the perfect conditions and facilities for practicing Bikram Yoga, a complete workout for the... Add to favourites Previous Next Must know Various times Lunchtime Touch & Turbo - Corporate League Lunchtime touch competition that will run at Victoria park for corporates every Monday and Tuesday. Its an opportunity for... Add to favourites The Viaduct Tepid Baths The grand Tepid Baths building proudly shows glimpses of its past while being sleek, modern and again ready to train... Add to favourites Silo Park & North Wharf Waterfront Bikes Get the first 1 hour of every ride at $0. Add to favourites Article Unlock Auckland with adidas Runners Looking for a running group? Every Tuesday night Auckland springs to action with the ever-growing adidas Runners, a free... Add to favourites Best gyms in the city centre Victoria Park Les Mills - Victoria Street Get sweaty and get social at Les Mills' flagship gym, with incredible group fitness classes and state of the art facilities. ... Add to favourites Aotea Arts Quarter Anytime Fitness Gym - Lorne Street Anytime Fitness Gym located on Lorne Street offers the luxury you need to achieve your fitness goals. Add to favourites Queen Street JustWorkout 24HR Gym - Swanson St JustWorkout offers Premium facilities, Great Group Fitness Classes, Yoga, Pilates, Boxing, Indoor Cycling, Personal Training... Add to favourites Queen Street One Five One Health Club This multi-facility gym had been running for over 20 years and its central location in the SAP Tower is great for those... Add to favourites Previous Next
